paragraphs.name: 59ff
paragraphs.text: Thanks! I chose this approach because I got tired of tutorials that just told me what to do, without telling me the considerations that led up to that. It’s more tasking to actually explain your thought process, but ultimately more rewarding to know people are helped.

paragraphs.name: 8a7c
paragraphs.text: Nice writeup! Currently though this allows malformed original input such as “s i n ( 4 5 )” to get normalized as “sin(45)” prior to be being tokenized. Was that intentional?

content.subtitle: I didn’t consider that case initially, but I think it’s all right. Let’s step back a bit: remember we chose to interpret a(4) as a call to…

paragraphs.name: d540
paragraphs.text: Great catch! Love it when folks approach a challenge critically.

I didn’t consider that case initially, but I think it’s all right. Let’s step back a bit: remember we chose to interpret a(4) as a call to a() with argument 4. We could interpret s i n ( 4 5 ) in two ways: sin() of 45 [function call] or s*i*n*45 [implicit…
Cool post! Have you looked at http://www.antlr.org/? It’s a pretty interesting library which does something like what you’re trying to achieve.
